lines.text: Property of region with magnetic force
External lines point from north to south
B is symbol for magnetic field
Magnetic field applies force on moving charge

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we describe and quantify magnetic fields?

Enduring Understandings:
1. [OBJ:expsec_q754:Magnets] are composed of north and south poles. [OBJ:expsec_q755:Magnetic field] lines point from the north pole of a magnet to the south pole of a magnet.
2. [OBJ:expsec_q757:Earth] is an example of a magnet. The magnetic field lines around Earth point from the south pole to the north pole. [OBJ:expsec_q758:Compasses] measure the magnetic fields on Earth.
3. The [OBJ:expsec_q759:force] that a magnetic field applies on a moving charge can be [OBJ:expsec_q761:calculated] by multiplying the charge by the velocity by the strength of the magnetic field.
